title: HTML Paragraphs
description: The <p> tag defines a paragraph. Browsers automatically add white space before and after paragraphs.
sub1_desc: Paragraphs start on a new line and are usually blocks of text.
example1:
This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.
sub2_desc: Adding extra spaces or line breaks in HTML does not affect how it appears in the browser.
example2:
This paragraph contains many lines in the source code, but the browser ignores it.

This paragraph has many spaces in the source code, but the browser ignores them.
sub3_desc: The <hr> tag defines a thematic break (a horizontal line) between content.
example3:
This is heading 1

This is some text.

This is heading 2

This is some other text.
sub4_desc: The <br> tag inserts a line break without starting a new paragraph.
sub5_desc: The <pre> tag keeps spaces and line breaks, displaying text exactly as written.
example5:
My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

My Bonnie lies over the sea.

My Bonnie lies over the ocean.

Oh, bring back my Bonnie to me.
note1: Note: Browsers collapse whitespace (spaces, tabs, newlines) in normal flow. Use <pre> to preserve formatting, or <br> for single line breaks.
